createProposal(address,address,uint256,b.details: Creates a Proposal from an existing Solution.Base

params.collateralToken: ERC20 token being used as collateral for conditional tokens
params.fundingGoal: Amount of ERC20 collateral requested for the Proposal
params.safeBaseId: ID of the Solution.Base for which a new instance and proposal is created
params.solutionsHub: Address of the SolutionsHub contract managing the Solution

defundProposal(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Called by user to remove their funding from a Proposal

executeIPFSProposal(bytes32,(address,add.details: Executes a proposal for Solutions where on the *hash* of solver configs is stored on-chain

params.solverConfigs: Configurations of Solvers to be run for the proposed solution

fundProposal(bytes32,address,uint256).details: Called by user to add funding to a Proposal

params.token: ERC20 token to be funded with

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: Handles the receipt of a multiple ERC1155 token types. This function is called at the end of a `safeBatchTransferFrom` after the balances have been updated. To accept the transfer(s), this must return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)"))` (i.e. 0xbc197c81, or its own function selector).

params.data: Additional data with no specified format
params.from: The address which previously owned the token
params.ids: An array containing ids of each token being transferred (order and length must match values array)
params.operator: The address which initiated the batch transfer (i.e. msg.sender)
params.values: An array containing amounts of each token being transferred (order and length must match ids array)

reclaimTokens(bytes32,uint256).details: Transfers reclaimable CTs to a claimer and lowers their reclaimable balance for that token

params.proposalId: ID of proposal being reclaimed from

transferERC20(bytes32,address).details: Called by SolutionsHub after deploying Solvers

params.proposalId: Proposal that collateral is being transferred from

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.notice: IMPORTANT! Any CTs sent to this contract are reclaimable by the funders in proportion to their funding. If a user reclaims CTs and sends them back again to this contract, they will only be able to  regain from them a fraction of their original funding.
